activities: InterMune, Inc. receives personal data from the EU/EEA and/or Switzerland, including data concerning: employees, potential employees and their family members, former employees, patients, physicians, service providers, vendors, investors and shareholders. These data are collected and transferred to the U.S. in support of the company's application maintenance and support, employment, research, development, regulatory compliance, marketing, sales, financial, legal and other business activities.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: On-line data - data collected directly on the Internet.
recoursemech: For organization human resources data: EU data protection authorities (EU DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC); For all other categories of data: TRUSTe
